com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill

Interface StagedIncreaseSkill

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArcherySkill, AxeSkill, BowSkill, ConcentrationSkill, CookingSkill, DexteritySkill, FashioningSkill, FishingSkill, ImbuementSkill, LogReducedSkill, LogSkill, LumberjackSkill, MagicWeaverSkill, MiningSkill, PatienceSkill, SmithingSkill, SorcerySkill, SwordsmanshipSkill, TacticsSkill, TwoHandedSkill

    public interface StagedIncreaseSkill
    A skill that doesn't just have one way to perform it -- and therefore, requires more than one way to calculate xp gains.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void performMajor(QuestPlayer participant, int actionLevel, boolean fail)
      Performs a large action of the skill, resulting in larger awarded xp.
      void performMinor(QuestPlayer participant, int actionLevel, boolean fail)
      Performs a small action of the skill, resulting in smaller awarded xp.

    • Method Detail

      • performMinor

        void performMinor(QuestPlayer participant,
                  int actionLevel,
                  boolean fail)
        Performs a small action of the skill, resulting in smaller awarded xp. Adds experience to the skill, standardized as the specified amount for performing an action of level actionLevel and either succeeding or failing, as determiend by fail
        Parameters:
        actionLevel - The level of the action that was performed. Maybe cooking salmon is a lvl 30 task, for example
        fail - whether or not the action was failed. May or not award xp on failure, as determined by config

      • performMajor

        void performMajor(QuestPlayer participant,
                  int actionLevel,
                  boolean fail)
        Performs a large action of the skill, resulting in larger awarded xp. Adds experience to the skill, standardized as the specified amount for performing an action of level actionLevel and either succeeding or failing, as determiend by fail
        Parameters:
        actionLevel - The level of the action that was performed. Maybe cooking salmon is a lvl 30 task, for example
        fail - whether or not the action was failed. May or not award xp on failure, as determined by config
